questions.text: What is the best measure of how effective our cybersecurity infrastructure is?
Which of the following best describes a zero-click attack?
options: An attack that uses brute force to crack passwords
An attack that exploits vulnerabilities in a system without any user interaction
An attack that targets the network infrastructure directly
An attack that involves clicking zeros as response
An attack that requires user interaction, such as clicking on a link or opening an attachment
questions.correctAnswer: An attack that exploits vulnerabilities in a system without any user interaction

questions.text: Command and Control (C2) is NOT used for which of the following activities by the adversary?
options: Knowing if the intended malware is installed on the target
Sending commands to the compromised system

questions.text: Which method is ranked highest for knowing if your internet-facing systems are being scanned?
In the MITRE ATT&CK framework, what is the relationship between tactics and techniques?
options: Techniques are the overarching goals, while tactics are the steps to achieve those goals
Techniques are the strategic objectives, and tactics are the tools used to accomplish them
Tactics are the overall goals of an adversary, while techniques are the specific methods used to achieve those goals
Tactics and techniques are interchangeable terms for adversary actions
Tactics are specific methods used to achieve techniques
questions.correctAnswer: Tactics are the overall goals of an adversary, while techniques are the specific methods used to achieve those goals

questions.text: What type of delivery mechanism is most commonly used in the 'Delivery' stage of the Cyber Kill Chain?
Which of the following is a method used to deceive attackers during the 'Actions on Objectives' stage in the Cyber Kill Chain?
What is the most relevant order of importance for IT system security?
What is the most reliable way to identify if someone from suspicious IP addresses is visiting your website?
During the 'Installation' stage of the Cyber Kill Chain, the attacker typically aims to:
options: Deploy additional tools for further attacks
Bypass security defenses of the target
Steal user credentials from the target
Establish persistence on the target's system
questions.correctAnswer: Establish persistence on the target's system
